column4: hi,everyone,could you kindly help me out?I have a t42 notebook with atheros wireless chip made for america markets.the wireless chip firmware set regdomain to 0x64,and can't work with wifi channel 13 on winxp.if I switch to ubuntu or debian,linux os could connect with ap via channel 13? I 'm in japan now.I wonder it linxu os could work around the eerom by virtually set regdomain to japan?
I have no live cd  now

:( hi,everyone,could you kindly help me out?I have a t42 notebook with atheros wireless chip made for america markets.the wireless chip firmware set regdomain to 0x64,and can't work with wifi channel 13 on winxp.if I switch to ubuntu or debian,linux os could connect with ap via channel 13? the driver will have to support it yes, but i cant look at that if i dont know the driver you are using
